Articles.Content:
Finally got it to work. Video of separation below. The failures were, honestly, far more entertaining than the successful launch.

Uses MechJeb pod on the back of the rocket to make orbital insertion easy and lazy.

Sometimes I wonder if it is actually even more efficient to launch a rocket in the air and watch the carrier slam into the ocean over the traditional launchpad.

...wait a minute, this is KSP! 8)

Not only is it FAR more entertaining, my carrier ship does awesome things like detach its rear landing gear, and optionally activate a ram-jet engine at ~5000m to carry the craft to 10000m. Its only about 150m/s free boost, but the delta-v expended for 75km orbit with the carrier ship ends up being ~3200m/s depending on your timing.

Takeoff for the carrier ship remains... challenging. After takeoff and dropping the first stage (rear landing gear) the thing is FREAKISHLY stable until you hit the ramjet at 5k. Even then its not that hard to control, around 10k it cannot sustain flight and you need to drop.
